alert.note: Alert for Northern Elko County; Northern Lander County and Northern Eureka County; Ruby Mountains and East Humboldt Range; South Central Elko County; Southeastern Elko County; Southern Lander County and Southern Eureka County; Southwest Elko County; White Pine County (Nevada) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued March 20 at 4:43AM PDT by NWS Elko
info.description: ......Rain and snow showers will continue across northern and central Nevada early this morning...... Current radar imagery is continuing to depict rain and snow showers falling across the area. Snow levels are fluctuating around the 5200 to 6500 foot level, depending on location. Nevada Department of Transportation webcams are showing snow occurring at Emigrant Summit on I-80, as well as Robinson Pass on US Highway 50 in Eureka county and Murry Summit on US 6 in White Pine county. In addition, a mix of rain and snow showers continue in the cities of Elko, and Wells, while rain showers are continuing in the Ely area. Look for the wet weather to continue through this morning with minor snow accumulations of one-half inch possible in the valleys, though some locations in central Nevada could see an inch or so. Early morning drivers should be aware of rapidly changing weather due to elevation. Please use caution as slippery road conditions are likely and use low beams during low visibility situations. Visit www.weather.gov/elko for the latest weather information.
